thread.title: In the huddle How area NFL players fared in Week 5
thread.title_full: In the huddle How area NFL players fared in Week 5

title: In the huddle How area NFL players fared in Week 5
text:
Published: Mon, October 12, 2015 @ 12:05 a.m. 
Cleveland Browns 
John Greco, OL, Boardman — Started at right guard in a 33-30 overtime win over the Ravens. 
Denver Broncos 
Derek Wolfe, DL, Beaver Local — Started at right defensive end in his first game after a suspension and made five tackles in a 16-10 win over Raiders. 
Green Bay Packers 
Corey Linsley, C, Boardman — Started at center in a 24-10 win over the Rams. 
Houston Texans 
Cecil Shorts, WR, Mount Union — Was not active in a 27-20 loss to the Colts. 
John Simon, LB, Cardinal Mooney — Was a substitute and made three tackles. 
New England Patriots 
Bradley Fletcher, CB, Liberty — Released on Saturday. 
New Orleans Saints 
Mike McGlynn, OL, Fitch — Was a substitute center in a 39-17 loss to the Eagles. 
Washington Redskins 
Pierre Garcon, WR, Mount Union — Started in a 25-19 overtime loss to the Falcons and made three receptions for 51 yards. 
Staff report
